Package viewcontrollers

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
viewcontrollers.Controller
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddModifyController, MainScreen
public class Controller extends Object
Describes methods common to all view controllers

  • Method Details

    • loadScene

      public void loadScene(javafx.event.ActionEvent event, String title, String view, String resolution) throws IOException
      Loads and renders a Scene based on the given View and applies the given metadata.
      Parameters:
      event - An event from which the Stage can be derived. Any will do, but this is expected to be the event passed into the event handler which calls this method.
      title - The desired Scene title to be displayed in the title bar of the resulting window.
      view - The name of the fxml View file we wish to render as a Scene.
      resolution - A String describing the resolution to render the scene at, of the format "[int] x [int]".
      Throws:
      IOException

    • loadMainScene

      public static void loadMainScene(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Loads and renders the main Scene.
      Parameters:
      stage - The Stage we wish to render the main Scene upon.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • validateIntInput

      public boolean validateIntInput(String s)
      Validates whether an int can be parsed from the given String.
      Parameters:
      s - The String to be validated.
      Returns:
      True if an int can be parsed from s, false otherwise.

    • validateDoubleInput

      public boolean validateDoubleInput(String s)
      Validates whether a double can be parsed from the given String.
      Parameters:
      s - The String to be validated.
      Returns:
      True is a double can be parsed from s, false otherwise.

    • redirectExitToMainScreen

      public void redirectExitToMainScreen(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Alters the Stage's Close button (the X at the top right on Windows or top left on Mac) such that it brings the user back to the main Scene instead of shutting down the application.
      Parameters:
      stage - The Stage whose Close button behavior is to be altered.

    • restoreExitBehavior

      public static void restoreExitBehavior(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Restores the Stage's exit behavior to its default state, such that it once again close the application when clicked.
      Parameters:
      stage - The Stage whose Close button behavior is to be restored.
